Participants.evidence: Participants included patients with anterior circulation LVOS, witnessed symptom onset, baseline MRI within 24 hours, and available day 1 imaging.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the role of infarct growth rate (IGR) as a predictor of HT compared to baseline infarct volume.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was any HT on day 1 imaging.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 775 patients (mean age 70.5 years) were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Faster IGR was independently associated with higher HT risk (adjusted OR 1.35; 95% CI 1.16–1.57).
